vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
πονηρ-ία, ἡ,
bad state or condition, ὀφθαλμῶν [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II in moral sense, wickedness, vice, knavery, ἡ μωρία.. ἀδελφὴ τῆς π. ἔφυ [Refs 5th c.BC+]; εἰς τὴν π. πάλιν τρέπεται turns again to vice, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: in plural, knavish tricks, rogueries, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II.2 baseness, cowardice, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.3 with a political connotation, mob-rule, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: evil, wickedness, malice, in the NT always a negative moral quality opposed to God and his goodness
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
evil, wickedness, malice, in the NT always a negative moral quality opposed to God and his goodness
primarily badness, bad condition; in NT evil disposition of mind, wickedness, mischief, malignity, malice Mt. 22:18; plural πονηριαι, wicked deeds, villanies, Mk. 7:23; Acts 3:26
